result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyrine Javor Donald was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 5/1/2023; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 5/1/2023; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Restitution set at zero.

Consecutive to: To any other sentence with credit for 0 days time served. STRAIGHT TIME.
Sentence to be served in the Wisconsin State Prison.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Defendant Tyrine Javor Donald in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Defendant Tyrine Javor Donald in custody.  Karen A. Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional Statements by: Earnestine B.

  The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 6 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 0 days time served.  STRAIGHT TIME. Sentence to be served in the Wisconsin State Prison.
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 5/1/2023; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 5/1/2023; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Restitution set at zero
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Tyrine Javor Donald in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Defendant Tyrine Javor Donald in custody.  Karen A. Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
State's Motion to consolidate with cases 14CF1108 and 13CF1003 granted.
AS TO COUNT 1:
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms; also defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until his/her civil rights are restored.
AS TO COUNT 2:
Pursuant to Plea Negotiations, COurt ordered Count 2 DISMISSED and READ IN.
Case calendared for SENTENCING on 11/3/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.
